Description: A glazed composition figure of a pig: originally green, but now dull brown in colour because of the decay of the glaze. The modelling of the body and legs is rather summary, but a fair amount of detail is shown in the head, including the eyes, ears, mouth and nostrils.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Chamber M69 deposit
Curator's comments: For parallels, see J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' I (London, 1989), pl.XVIII, 9; B. Adams, 'Ancient Hierakonpolis' (Warminster, 1974), 21, no. 107 and pl.14. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl. VI, 66..
